availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert Wickliffe Woolley (Fayette County, KY, lawyer and soldier)

body.p: Fayette County, Kentucky, lawyer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Sallie Woolley. Graduated from Transylvania University in Lexington, Kentucky. Attended Harvard Law School in Cambridge, Massachusetts, in 1848. Lawyer in Fayette County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned twenty-eight enslaved persons in Fayette County in 1850. Resident of Lexington, Kentucky, in 1860. Household owned sixteen enslaved persons in Lexington in 1860. Captain on the staff of General James J. Archer (C.S.A.) from August 2, 1862, to January 1, 1863. Colonel on the staff of General Simon Bolivar Buckner.

ab.bibl:

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 1, p. 577.

List of Staff Officers of the Confederate States Army (Washington: Government Printing Office, 1891), 183.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky: Confederate Kentucky Volunteers War 1861-65, vol. 2 (Frankfort: Legislature of Kentucky, 1915), p. 414.
